abstract: Carl C. Icahn, the billionaire activist investor, continued his campaign to gain a seat on Motorola‘s board, this time making his pitch directly to the cellphone maker’s shareholders. In a letter to shareholders filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission Friday, Mr. Icahn said that the company’ financial woes “reflect not only operational failures, but are also symptoms of a passive and reactive board.”
